Uses of Package
nz.ac.auckland.morc.mock.builder

  • Packages that use nz.ac.auckland.morc.mock.builder 
    Package Description
    nz.ac.auckland.morc  
    nz.ac.auckland.morc.mock.builder  
  • Classes in nz.ac.auckland.morc.mock.builder used by nz.ac.auckland.morc 
    Class and Description
    AsyncMockDefinitionBuilder
    Generates an mock definition for ensuring asynchronous messages will be received at some point in the future.
    ExceptionMockDefinitionBuilder
    This builder will add a repeated processor that sets an exception response to calls - this is likely to cause transaction rollback or some kind of SOAP fault

    If no exception is specified then an empty Exception is thrown
    HttpErrorMockDefinitionBuilder
    This will cause a Jetty or CXF endpoint (message consumer) to throw an HTTP 500 (or other) error with the specified body - this could be a SOAP fault message in the case of a web-service

    It is recommended to use SoapFaultMockDefinitionBuilder if you want to throw correct CXF SOAP Faults
    SoapFaultMockDefinitionBuilder
    This will cause a CXF endpoint (message consumer) to return a specified SOAP fault back to the consumer
    SyncMockDefinitionBuilder
    A concrete implementation of SyncMockDefinitionBuilderInit
    UnreceivedMockDefinitionBuilder
    A builder to generate a mock definition that ensures no message is expected to be received at this point.
  • Classes in nz.ac.auckland.morc.mock.builder used by nz.ac.auckland.morc.mock.builder 
    Class and Description
    ContentMockDefinitionBuilderInit
    A builder to generate a mock definition that validates the bodies and headers for an incoming message
    ExceptionMockDefinitionBuilder
    This builder will add a repeated processor that sets an exception response to calls - this is likely to cause transaction rollback or some kind of SOAP fault

    If no exception is specified then an empty Exception is thrown
    HttpErrorMockDefinitionBuilder
    This will cause a Jetty or CXF endpoint (message consumer) to throw an HTTP 500 (or other) error with the specified body - this could be a SOAP fault message in the case of a web-service

    It is recommended to use SoapFaultMockDefinitionBuilder if you want to throw correct CXF SOAP Faults
    SyncMockDefinitionBuilderInit
    A builder that generates a mock definition that will set the body or headers for a message response
    UnreceivedMockDefinitionBuilder
    A builder to generate a mock definition that ensures no message is expected to be received at this point.
